chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Marcus Jay Delafuente was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges granted.    Pursuant to s. 346.65(7), Wis. Stats., Defendant shall be required to remain in the County Jail for not less than a 48 consecutive hour period prior to release for huber.
Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Same repayment provisions apply as noted above for the Fine.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 3:40 PM: Defendant Marcus Jay Delafuente in court with attorney William Michael Lennon.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joint Recommendation for SEH recited by ADA.  Def and counsel concurs with State's recital.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Agrees with 1 prior conviction as recited by the Court.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea Ct 1 (OWI 2): NC   Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Ct 2 dismissed outright.  Ct 3 DRI.  Statement by Def:  None offered.  The Court: Accepts agreement reached and  Imposes 10 days WCJ, Huber, GT and 1 day TS credit, Report:  4/1/2016 at 8:00 PM w/48 consecutive hours of service prior to release for Huber; $1492 Fine - 60 DTP or PP; 13 mos DL Rev/IID - Def encouraged to obtain an Occ DL as soon as able as Rev period cannot be sat off; OWI Assessment prior to relicensing.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney William Michael Lennon in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Lennon states offer has been extended and resolution reached. Requests Plea/Sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 03:45 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Marcus Jay Delafuente in court with attorney William Michael Lennon. Atty Lennon appears telephonically. Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Lennon was recently appointed on this matter and is requesting another STC.  Status conference scheduled for February 9, 2016 at 09:50 am.

Case Called @ 1:26 PM: Defendant Marcus Jay Delafuente in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions Defendant as to status of counsel.  Def has been laid off and again contacted SPD for eligibility.  Information needs to be provided to SPD on termination prior to eligibility to be confirmed.  Court willing to adjourn today's proceedings but advises Def that case must move forward.  Amended Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Status conference scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Case Called @ 1:38 PM: Defendant Marcus Jay Delafuente in court, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel.  Def intends to proceed with retaining his own counsel.  Court will proceed with that understanding.  NGP entered by Court.   In person STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for December 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.    No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.
SPD Szilagyi and Defendant, Marcus Delafuente

Case Called @ 1:00 PM: Defendant Marcus Jay Delafuente in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi, both appearing via video.  Defendant Marcus Jay Delafuente in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Per SPD:  Eligibility will depend on custody status.  Court advises Def of continuing right to counsel.  ADA argues as to Signature Bond of $1000 or low cash bond of perhaps $250 w/conditions.  Argument as to bond by SPD:  Joins in request for Signature Bond due to residency status.  The Court:  Orders Signature Bond of $1000.00 w/conditions as requested.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  SPD confirms that Def will no longer be eligible for SPD services due to release.  Def advised that he will need to appear further at the IA.  Initial appearance scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 01:40 pm.
